Summary: I enjoyed my stay at the Howard Johnson in Buena Park. The room was nice and clean. It’s very close to several restaurants and fast food. It’s also right down the street from Knotts berry farm. Overall I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello Crystal, Thank you for taking time to share your review with us.  We're happy to hear the stay was great and appreciate you recognizing the great service provided by our staff.  We hope to see you soon, Safe Travels! Kat #Team6

Summary: Such a surprise. As a traveling family we have road tripped all across the United States full time. However sometimes our budgets require a less “glamorous” stay. We did not have high expectations but this hotel beyond exceeded them! We had a very clean room. Clean beds. And more importantly a clean toilet and bathroom. Housekeeping ladies are lovely and kind. They stopped by every day to offer service and restock any towels and necessities needed. Front desk manager and workers were always kind and very helpful. They are pet friendly, which is necessary for us as we travel with our 2 chihuahuas. The pool was great for the kids and was maintained beautifully by the maintenance man. Great job on the management and new policy’s. There is security patrolling the parking lot all
Room tip: There is a Starbucks, Chipotle, Jack in the box all in the same parking lot. So many good options...
Manager Response: Hi Traveler,  We are glad you had a great experience and appreciate your feedback!  We look forward to providing your future lodging needs.  Maz K. #Team6

Summary: If I could rate it a ZERO I would. I  wanted to trust the ONE GOOD review this hotel had, but I was wrong. I literally checked in and went to use the restroom, where I found at least 5 baby roaches!! It was so disgusting. My friends on the other hand were laying down after a long 5 hour drive to find more roaches ON THE BED!!!! This was absolutely terrifying, we RAN out as fast as we could. When we spoke to reception they could not guarantee a clean and roach free room. At that moment I did not care for a refund, we just wanted to leave ASAP. Keep in mind that it was 2 AM. Do not stay here unless you want to take roaches home!!!!
Manager Response: Hi Catalina, Thanks for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. We’d like to apologize for any inconvenience you experienced as a guest. We hold ourselves to a high standard and plan to give this issue the attention it deserves.  It’s valued guests like you who are always driving us to be better, and we appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  Lilith #Team6

Summary: We had asked for a room change and we’re told everything was sold out but seriously? There’s so many rooms and little cars in the parking lot. Room smelled like smoke and made it difficult to stay in room since we have respiratory concerns… …..
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. We’d like to apologize for any inconvenience you experienced as a guest. We hold ourselves to a high standard and plan to give this issue the attention it deserves.  It’s valued guests like you who are always driving us to be better, and we appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  Nancy Y. #Team6

Summary: We got there late due to LAX car rental taking 8 hrs (separate issue)  and had to wait in the car because system was down or something to that effect. We were so exhausted so when we finally got to our room I was very frustrated. We were there 5mins and that room reales of smoke! I went all the way down to reception and asked if we can get a room change to which they replied “they are all non smoking but it’s still going to smell like smoke” I replied with “WOW” and front desk seemed embarrassed to which they offered to send house keeping to spray something to help with the odor. I agreed, went back to the room and house keeping knocks. “I don’t need service I just got here but if you can spray something for the odor that be great” I got “we don’t have anything to help with the
Manager Response: After reading your review, we’re disappointed to learn that we fell short of your expectations. We’re constantly trying to improve in order to provide the best guest experience possible, so we appreciate your honesty.  In the meantime, we’ll look into these issues and do our best to address them. Thanks again for your time, and we hope to see you again soon.  Nancy Y. #Team6

Summary: As I read the negative reviews I wondered if we were at the same place. The room was very clean, bedding, etc was top notched.  No issues with noise.  Great restaurants nearby. No breakfast here but never said there was so I wasn't expecting it but enough places nearby. Staff was friendly and helpful.

This place is top notch for the price compared to many places in and around the area.  It is not fancy but it is clean and feels safe. Pets are allowed and they provide poop bags in the grass area.  They ac stays blowing and works well. The staff is friendly, competent and tough.  There is a well maintained pool. I stayed in two different rooms and did not see one bug. If you pull up the sheets the mattress cover is clean and housekeeping wears gloves and masks. The shower curtains are washed and the water pressure is great. The sheets are clean and there are trash cans on every corner. Some hotels no longer have trash cans out on the property.  There is plenty of parking and lots of places to eat. Arthur, Blake, Nicole and Heather were so awesome and helpful. I made my
Room tip: Go here if you are in the area and want a budget friendly clean room.  Way better than the hotels...

Summary: We spent our last night of our 2 week California road trip in this hell hole. All of the other places we stayed were budget, which meant basic but clean. They provided everything we needed for our bust busy schedule! Not this place, filthy from top to bottom. Both our non-smoking rooms had a strong stale smoke odour, dirty bathrooms, stained towels, dirty clothes left in ours from the previous customers. It was vile. I did try to raise these issues with reception and got a disingenuous, "Oh I'll let management know." Frankly, if management cannot see how disgusting the place is, passing on my complaint is not going to help. This place is really damaging to the Motel 6 brand. Strongly recommend finding another place to stay.
Manager Response: Hi Charl,  On behalf of Motel 6, we would like to apologize for the inconvenience you incurred while our guest.  This is not our standard, and we take reports of poor housekeeping very seriously.  We are committed to guest satisfaction and appreciate you taking time to review your experience.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

Summary Heading: Easy place to get to, friendly staff
Summary: Very reasonable rates, room was clean, internet reliable, great shower with good water pressure and friendly staff what more could you want. Hungry Jacks just out front and a  Del taco just across the street, both easy walking distance
Room tip: right next to the 5 so could be noisy....I guess if it bothers you ask for a room that would be...
Manager Response: Hi Cameron,  Thank you for sharing your review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay!  Until the next time, We’ll Leave the Light on For You!

Summary Heading: For me one of the Best places to stay for more than one or two to three weeks
Summary: I have no problems or regret saying in this Motel6 all personal and Night cruz are so good so I says take my word give it a try just read member let you be the judge. Thanks and god bless you and your family and don’t forget anything you feel that you do not like just let them know and I promise they will take care of it.
Manager Response: Hi Samuel,  Thank you for sharing your review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay!  Until the next time, We’ll Leave the Light on For You!

Summary: My family stayed here twice but will not anymore. The bed cover had these grease stains. Just nasty! The maid did not even clean the bathroom. Bad service. The area is nice and close to the freeway. There is a starbucks and marie calendars next to it for breakfast. You only get coffee in the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear S Sanders,   Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable room and apologize for any failure in delivering on the commitment during your recent stay. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the comfort issues you describe. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience.

Summary: It was okay. Broken elevators, stains on the beds and the room was still dirtty. Also, the maid came and asked if i needed towels, i said yes and gave her my old ones and she said she had no more clean ones and she will be back in a couple hours, well I'm still waiting.
Manager Response: Dear Jean,   Thank you for posting your review. Our staff aims to provide the highest level of hospitality to our guests through our customer service, but with your experience we have fallen short and would like to apologize for the service issues you describe. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest, and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the inconveniences you experienced with housekeeping. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: Besides the dirty comforters and smelly rooms...roaches are included for free. California homeless population has quadruple d. I thought I was back in Denver..stay off the weed people.  Your are already slow...
Manager Response: Dear Traveler,   Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We strive to deliver a great guest experience, but it sounds as though we did not perform to our usual standards in this case. We have procedures in place related to our pest policy that should have prevented the inconveniences you describe. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable room and apologize for any failure in delivering on the commitment during your recent stay. Please accept our apologies that your stay was less than satisfactory. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: Our first time staying at a Motel 6. All the hotels where booked for our trip to Knotts.  The only thing good about hotel close to restaurants ( walking distance) and Knotts is close driving distance.  The room was big had corner room with hard wood floors.  There was black hairs on our towels gross. The bed was not the best made squeaking noises every time we moved.  There was a hair in the microwave ( didn't use).  We had to stay 2 nights here.  I think I have said enough.

Summary Heading: Not a fan of this Motel 6
Summary: I found the Motel 6 online and it had a great price for my 10 day trip.  What I found was it was not clean and the area was sketchy.  I am sad to report this because I like to give good reviews.  They made the bed every day and cleaned tidied up but the sheets and bed clothes weren't changed.  The ground always looked dirty outside.  It was convenient to where I was going.  There are better hotels in the area.

Located just a little less than 2 miles west of Knott's Berry Farm on Beach Blvd this Motel 6 could probably achieve a lot more with some effort.  It was a great rate for what we got but it's such a beautiful location.  It's being run more like a Knights Inn.  If you haven't been to one of those avoid them.  The check in desk isn't very inviting and is barren.  I looked at it and wanted out ASAP. With some upgrades and proper management they could turn this spot around.

The only thing I can say is NO!!  Don’t stay here.  Motel 6 is a very basic motel, that is understood, but this one is right at the 91 freeway and very noisy!  The furniture was falling apart, bed was uncomfortable, it was awful!  I didn’t feel safe here!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the noise concerns you describe. Safety and security are high priorities within Motel 6 standards for quality, and we regret you felt differently during your visit. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your stay to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary Heading: Worst customer service I've ever heard.
Summary: Last night around 12am I called the motel and talked to a gentleman that declined to tell me his name. He put me on hold 2x without ever answering any of my questions. After 10 minutes he said just hang up and book online. I told him I wanted to know the rates for the day and I would like to do it through him. He said call back then click reservation line. I told him I could just do it with him so he hung up. I called back clicked option 2 for reservations and it was closed so I called back and he said he had to put me on hold AGAIN!!! Then he said the rates per day so FAST that I couldn't hear him because of his accent. Then he told me to get a calculator and add up everything this figure it out myself. Being someone who makes a profession from doing customer service I think
Manager Response: Dear Guest, The service experience you describe is not characteristic of the level of service our colleagues strive to provide, and we apologize your stay was unsatisfactory. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your stay to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: I must admit prior to my stay I relied on the reviews to determine whether to stay or go. My family and I stayed from just June 4-June 6 (today). I must admit our stay was pleasant our room was clean and it was very, very quiet. One thing I will agree with the other reviews on were the "tweakers" or "sketchy" people. But, they have to pay their heads down some where too.

If I knew they were charging the price of the room PER adult, I would’ve stayed at a 4 or 5 star hotel for $114 a night! They totally ripped me off! On top of that, I checked in at 5:45pm and was told they were still cleaning rooms?!?! Isn’t normal check in at 3pm as stated. The rooms are TINY! I got both the Standard and The Double Room. Our beddings had stains and tears. The curtains have black gunk on them, and the room is soooo small they flush the bed against the air conditioner which is probably a fire hazard. This is my first and LAST experience with a Motel 6!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing your feedback. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable visit and apologize for any failure in following through on that commitment during your recent stay. We strive to provide a clean, comfortable stay and are disappointed your visit was unsatisfactory due to the odor concern you describe. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your stay to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: I would recommend this Motel 6 if you are staying in the area...good service...clean rooms...quiet...The front check in desk employees are friendly and I give a special good remarks for Daisy...She is always taking care of the quest and does her job well!!

My husband and I stayed at the Buena Park Motel 6 during our recent Disney vacation and we had a great experience. We spent eight nights in the motel and while we weren't there much, it was a perfect place to sleep and recharge. The room was very small but clean and the staff was incredible. Huge thank you to April who not only helped us out with housekeeping needs but she also gave us great tips on where to eat.  The location was pretty good with easy access to freeways, dining and shops. My only complaint is that we experienced a lot of freeway noise. That's not really the hotel's fault but if you want to experience less noise, I would choose a room facing the inner courtyard. The overall hotel noise was minimal with almost zero noise coming from the  surrounding rooms. The

Summary Heading: I wish I hadn't booked for 4 nights! 1 was enough!
Summary: The rooms are too small. The T.V., not mounted on the wall, takes up most of the shelf space. I was trying to use my laptop and printer but was cramped because of the T.V. taking so much space.  . The Internet sucks too. They advertise the rooms have internet, not that one needs to pay for it. Then one finds that it's also PER DEVICE. If a family is staying at Motel 6 for the cheaper price, the cost of the Internet PER DEVICE kills the savings. Even just myself, I just used EITHER my laptop OR my smartphone because it would've killed my savings to have both over the hotel I left.  . I'm now back at the other hotel because they have free Internet, with no funny business, and the rooms are not so claustrophobic. There's also more water pressure in the shower, so I can actually

I needed a place for 3 nights that was not that expensive and close to Disneyland for a quick getaway. This was it. First I got charged more than what the website fee stated, not a whole lot ( I was told it is tourist season, when isn't it in California), have to give I.D.'s of ALL adults in party so they can take a picture of them( never done that in all the years of traveling), room smelled of smoke when I first opened door( asked for non smoking, found an ashtray upside down in room), beds were very hard not comfortable to sleep on, no dresser just 2 little cubbies, no micro wave or mini frig, toilet seat broken along with faucet spout,  for 3 people 2 small bars of soap( they did smell very good) no shampoo, mold outside room on side walk and in the plant areas, our keys
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your feedback. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the comfort issues and noise concerns you describe. We are sorry to hear about the inconvenience you experienced with the smoke smell during your stay.   Our standards for quality rest on our promise to offer the lowest price of any national chain by delivering the essential elements of a comfortable room for a satisfying stay, for this reason we apologize for the disappointment you describe with our check-in verification process. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: Very unhappy when we get there the check-in was okay Young lady was very professional her name is Alondra Ayala however we got to the room open the door to put our belongings in. We left back out to go eat at Shakey's get back to the room and they were roaches in the room very unhappy not able to get a good night's sleep.
Manager Response: Dear Wanda, Thank you for taking the time to share your review and recognizing our friendly staff. We strive to deliver a great guest experience, but it sounds as though we did not perform to our usual standards in this case. We have procedures in place related to our pest policy that should have prevented the inconveniences you describe. Please accept our apologies that your stay was less than satisfactory. We encourage you to contact Guest Services at 1-855-787-9864  to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: The room was clean with nothing out of place. Even though it was a smoking room, you could not tell! Daisy was absolutely incredible!!! Beautiful girl with a great personality.... what is not to like?! She was perfect in her customer service
Manager Response: Dear Ddrlasvegas,  We appreciate you recognizing our excellent service, and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. If you haven't already done so, please call our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to share your experience. We hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels.

Summary: The hotel overall was okay. The rooms were a good size. The staff was friendly. They made your beds each morning. The bathroom curtain did have a horrible smell to it. Seemed like it hasn't been washed. I wish I would of known the pool was being redone. I had 4 kids with me so it was a bummer. If anyone if looking for a motel with a pool this pool won't be done to the July 28th 2017 I believe. So at least thats great they are redoing it but wish i would of known before i booked. Over all it was okay. Next time I probably will stay at a different motel/hotel
Manager Response: Dear Gabriela, Thank you for sharing your review. We apologize for the condition of the pool during your stay and any inconvenience it caused you. The service issues you describe are atypical to Motel 6 standards for quality, and we are sorry you experienced less than satisfying service during your visit. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: Atiana and Arriel were very helpful when we checked in. Even checked if a room was available for early check in and one was. Atiana was the main front desk help and was great then Arriel made the experience better by helping her out executing the process quick.. great job!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate you recognizing our excellent service, and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. If you haven't already done so, please call our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to share your experience. We hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels.

Summary: Special thanks to Arriel and Atiana for their great professional customer service. Both of them are great young ladies that will go above and beyond to accommodate your needs to the best of their abilities. Great stay always.
Manager Response: Dear Kevin,  We appreciate you recognizing our excellent staff, and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. If you haven't already done so, please call our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to share your experience. We hope to see you again soon. Safe Travels.

Summary: The front desk employees where awesome. Arriel and Atiana welcomed you as soon as you step inside. The stay at motel 6 was wonderful very quite very comfortable beds.yhe area around this motel is awesome very close to the 91 freeway both east and west. Food and gas stations within walking distances.

the experience that we had at this Motel 6 was great the room locations and the room Cleanest of the room. plus the shopping centers Restaurants and amusement park was just perfect and also there are two person that we have to thanks. there are  coquese  Howard and Daisy from the MOTEL 6

Summary Heading: It is a good motel between knottsberry farm and Disney
Summary: This motel isn't that bad  as others have wrote :-).  While we were here we did not see any cop cars ,Other than normal noise for any motel .  The office staff was great and nice . We will stay here again

Cashier atiana was the best very friendly and informative had a great stay showers where get good pressure and very hot rooms are sparkling clean and maids very friendly i really had a great stay here and its down the street from knotts berry farm

Well,I was helped by a beautiful blonde at the front desk to my room upstairs.I had a interview in the morning.I still need to get a hold of my recruiter with the sophisticated words thanks to Yahoo's!hacked accounts.Thank you Ashely for the E-mail to cheer me up.The customer service was magnificent even when I called the front desk all questions answered.I recommend spa suites,and a upgrade on the rooms."Make Disneyland great again."

Re:  Motel 6 #1053; Buena Park, CA; Room 125; Friday, October 28, 2016  VERY NOISY, SMOKEY NON-SMOKING ROOM  We checked into the motel in the late afternoon and dropped our luggage in our room before leaving for the evening's activities.  Our room was located at the end of a narrow inner "courtyard".  The sidewalk to our room was dirty and littered with cigarette butts.  The area smelled of urine.   Although the room appeared clean and had a scented air freshener smell to it when we checked in, but by the time we got back late in the evening, the air freshener had dissipated and room smelled of tobacco smoke.  That was just the beginning of discovering problems with the room.  When we turned on the old air conditioner, it made such a racket that we couldn't even carry on a

The Motel 6 on Valley View in Buena Park is not the type of Motel 6 you might think it is. Nationwide, most Motel 6s are being renovated or have been renovated... Not this one in early October, 2016. It doesn't have the modern and clean feel that many renovated locations have.  The floors were filthy in the room. They are the laminate hard floors, so this is inexcusable. I shouldn't be contemplating buying Swiffer when we check in. The motel acts as a landing place for people who are very in between apartments. It has a sketchy vibe to it. We never once saw security on property. The elevator at the front of the building was crusted and sticky. It was never cleaned in the 4 days we were there. The water pressure in the sink was so low that I decided to brush my teeth in the
Manager Response: Jay,  Thank you for sharing your feedback. We apologize for any misunderstanding that may have occurred during your recent stay with regard to our rate policies and the inconveniences you experienced. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable room and apologize for any failure in following through on that commitment during your recent stay. Our staff aims to provide the highest level of hospitality to our guests through our customer service, but with the experience you describe we have fallen short and would like to apologize for the service issues you experienced. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: This Motel 6 has the best customer service around. The staff is so friendly , helpful,  and professional. I absolutely love their employees. Daisy,  Wendy,  Mimi, Maggie,  Pam, Hossan,  Michelle etc you guys are fabulous.  Housekeeping is  awesome.  Rooms are always clean.  This place makes me feel at home from check in , to check out

This hotel is central to everything! Super close to Knotts and restaurants ! I was so worried about the cleanliness of the rooms based off of other reviews but I was pleasantly surprised! The beds were so comfy and clean! The room itself was very clean . Basic for sure but clean and orderly!

Great change from DL and DCA, the rides here are great for those who seek thriller type rides. Fun for all ages. Plenty to do, great shows,food,water rides,children's rides, plenty of parking. Wear a hat, sunscreen, drink plenty of water and don't for get your camera. Wear comfortable shoes. Must see is the western show is superb. Have fun and enjoy your day.  They also have annual passes, so much cheaper than DL or DCA. We will be back soon. Be safe & have fun

Summary Heading: Okay place to stay - but would rather be somewhere else
Summary: If you are staying for a short term, like 1 or 2 nights, but I would not suggest anything longer.  This motel close to the freeways, and to local attractions, which is okay for an overnight stay for weary truckers.  The rooms are neat, clean linens, but bedspreads are old and have cigarette burns in them, and even the non-smoking rooms have a bad smell, like a dirty ashtray is hidden somewhere in the room.  And that's not to mention the cockroaches that scurry when you turn the lights on at night!  This was my only choice because they allow pets, but I would search for some place else.  Motel 6 has always been one of my choices for an out of town stay, or when I have had to be out of my home to have work done on my home, but I will not come back to this location.  Even though

Hi this I'm Joe Lomas I am one of Motel 6 happy customer and as a guest to and every time I have stayed to any of the Motel 6 like in Staton and  in Whittier and know motel 6 Buena Park -Knottsberry farm. So I made a reservation I called to see if they had a room on the bottom floor which they did and it was a double bed and daisy was a awesome employee and had a great personality and next to her was Pamela these girls gave me a sense of being at home. I felt like i was part of the family and I believe as a guest it's always good to feel  like u are  part of the of the Motel 6 and they're going to be there for us and thank you Motel 6.

I've stayed at quite a few motel 6's and other hotel chains, but this motel 6 in Buena Park, provided the best customer service ever.  I mean of all hotels that I have stayed, this one tops it all.  Not just help me with my hotel charge, but gave me the lower cost.  I made reservation online, but when speaking with CSR of "Hotel Planner"; which is part of Expedia, she would not help me on booking the lower cost.  I tried asking about booking first floor, non-smoking and she was only trying to charge more, to guarantee me a room.  Even would not take my AARP card to get the 10% or 15%. discount.   Very disappointed with Expedia, other companies.  I was able to cancel reservation and Motel 6 gave me the lower cost which saved me $16.14 which with my part time work, every savings I

I stay here at Motel 6 about 2-3 days out of the week and I have always been very satisfied with the Motel 6 employee staff. Aileen. Maggie. Wendy, Daisy, Pamela, Tammie and Mimi they all are very helpful and friendly. The overall customer service ive received has been excellent. The rooms are always clean. I always ask for a smoking room and when i get into the room it smells good, not like cigarettes. I am very satisfied overall. Thank you motel 6.

The rooms are small but it is surprisingly quiet here lot of people wandering around but they're friendly an OK place to stay if you need some for a day or two. There are a lot of places to eat around here it's easy to get to pretty much anything a lot of things are in within walking distance plenty of restaurants places to eat it's kept clean as far as Motel 6 is gold this is probably one of the five best ones to go

Excellent staff, got the room I wanted at a great price. Nice laundry room, clean microwave area adjacent to lobby. Clean, pleasant looking property. Needs (and deserves) flat screen TV from corporate MOTEL 6. Many other Motel 6 properties have their full upgrade, some not as nice! How come, Corporate Motel 6?

This location was wonderful with a full staff that was able to accommodate us in every way. I am really please with the hospitality and the location over all. I want to thank the manager  aileen and the the  receptionist named Wendy and daisy and the rest of the girls  were great . Very friendly and accommodating and very helpful. The maintenence I belived named Alfred were nice. Thank you all for ur hospitality

Summary Heading: You can do better for the money
Summary: I know motel 6 is a budget motel but they don't even have shampoo in room. Not very clean, it smelled like weed and dirty socks. The vending machine took my 2$ but I did not get my water. It was very noisy at night time and someone knocked on my door at 3 am. I did not get a lot of sleep. The shower ran too hot so I turned it to cold and then I could not get the water warm for ten minutes. I took a mostly cold shower.
Manager Response: Sandra,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We strive to provide a clean, comfortable room and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the odor concern and bed comfort issues you describe. Please accept our apologies for the inconveniences you describe. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: We were greeted on our way to our room by mattresses aligning the Corredor and we had to step over carpet cleaning hoses as they were cleaning the mattresses… Not a good sign. we had to get a new key before we were even able to open our door, since the key we were given did not work. The room stunk of cigarettes. The carpet was filthy. There were no pictures on the walls, the tv was from the 1980's and sat on a desk. There were no soaps or shampoos in the bathroom. Upon doing our routine bed bug checks, we found stains on the sheets, what could have possibly been bed bug feces on the mattress, the mattresses were filthy and stained and to top everything off, the original lock on the door had been broken and instead of replacing it they had just installed a new one above it.

Room was supposed to be non smoking room, yet it smelled if cigarettes.  The TV would not stay powered on.  When I reported everything to the front desk, there was no help. The front desk clerk wouldn't come to check the room. I asked to checkout and was told i wasn't eligible for a refund.  I called customer service and there was no answer.

Arrived late at night after leaving Disneyland, about a 10 minute drive. Received an extremely warm welcome from the owner, who was very kind and helpful. The room was very clean and recently redone. The bed was fairly comfy and surprisingly NOT hard as a board. Definitely surpassed my expectations for the price. Very small pool which didn't look the cleanest, and no jacuzzi. Walls were a little thin, but if you bring earplugs you won't hear a thing. Altogether I was very pleased and would definitely return, especially to support these very kind small business owners for such a good experience!

Frequently over my career I traveled to the same areas where customers were nearby. Whenever I had to go to SoCal (Southern California in popular parlance) I tried to split the so-called baby and choose a central location, close to appropriate freeways and in a safer part of town frankly. So it was that I returned to the convergence of Route 91 & Interstate 5 next to Anaheim in Buena Park. It's a solid, hard working, blue collar neighborhood with the usual malls and such, It is also down the road a bit from Knotts Berry Farm (where I have also stayed this past year FYI) and as such sees more than its fair share of traffic, literally and figuratively. (See past review of that trip somewhere listed within the Trip Advisor history). Anyway I headed back to the same property that I
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for sharing your post. Motel 6 standards for quality rest on our promise to offer the lowest price of any national chain by delivering the essential elements of a comfortable room for a satisfying stay, for this reason we apologize for the disappointment you describe with the expectations of our housekeeping cleaning of the guestroom.   We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your stay to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: Had a great experience during my stay  My room was really clean and great restaurants within walking distance  Definitely will stay again and will recommend it. I really like the location convenience and felt area was safe and it seemed family friendly.

Summary Heading: Had a great stay at motel 6 In buena park,ca
Summary: I stayed at motel 6 for a week with my dog,and I had a good experience. The rooms were clean. The office staff were very helpful. I would like to point out that Maggie would always polite and in a good mood no matter how many questions I had. She really made me feel comfortable staying here. I would definitely recommend this motel 6 to my family and friends.

We reserved a two night stay at this motel on Booking.com via Trip Advisor for March 9th and 10th. After checking in on March 9th, we went to Disneyland on the 10th, and upon arriving back at the motel at 2 a.m. found they had packed up our belongings and rented our room out due to the negligence of their own staff! The night manager refused to look at my phone when I tried showing her we had booked a two night reservation and tried to blame us for their mistake! So at 2 a.m. we had nowhere to go and had to drive around for an hour looking for another motel. I emailed the main headquarters with my complaint over a week ago and still have not heard back from them. I wil be contacing the BBB.
Manager Response: Karina, Thank you for sharing your concerns. Please know the service issues you describe are an exception to our guest commitment and as such, we apologize.  Our staff aims to provide the highest level of hospitality to our guests through our customer service, but with your experience we have fallen short and would like to apologize for the service issues you describe.   We invite you to contact our Guest Relations at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary Heading: Not what I expected but decent.
Summary: The Good: Hotel was clean, mostly updated. Beds were comfy and everything worked like it should. The windows being able to open was a huge advantage. Lots of food options around (Del Taco, Jack in the Box, a Mexican restaurant, sub shop, and an amazing pizza place. 15-20 minutes from Disneyland when you don't want to use the freeways, and about 15 minutes when you do use the freeways. Knott's Berry Farm was even closer but we didn't go. Target and Walmart are both about a ten minute drive away, as well as more food options.   The Bad: Hotel was plagued by prostitutes and drug addicts. It was loud and sketchy. My fiancée kept getting asked if he was alone and 'wanted some company.' Police were there several times. Housekeeping didn't do anything more than change the towels (even

My family spent the night at the Motel 6 Buena Park on July 13, 2015. We knew that it was a Motel 6 and had no expectations for a spectacular room, but this place was DISGUSTING! The non-smoking room that we were placed in reeked of cigarette smoke so badly that it knocked you back as soon as you opened the door. The tub had black mold all over it and there was a hole in the bottom. The beds were horrible and the noise from other people in the parking lot made it difficult to sleep. It was obvious that illegal activity was taking place on the upper floors and the next morning you could see/smell the evidence of that activity. I would not stay another night in this hotel if Motel 6 gave it to me for free! I probably would not even consider staying in another Motel 6 ANYWHERE.
Manager Response: Dear Shea,              Thank you for sharing your review. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the odor concern you describe. Please know that the conditions you describe are atypical to Motel 6 standards for quality and we apologize for the inconveniences you experienced. Our standards for quality rest on the promise to offer the lowest price of any national chain by delivering the essential elements of a comfortable room for a satisfying stay, for this reason we apologize for the disappointment you describe with the expectations of amenities. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary: stayed there before on In July.... The is the worst , lying  manager... Noami- a stabbing took place on the second floor  2  rooms down from us... the maids walked into our rooms on my husband making love ... i called  & filed a complaint... and then  when we were going to pay for another  week, she told the front desk NR .. i still have the emails that i sent to  customer service and how the company  has ignored this.... this place is  a joke... the worst service.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,                Thank you for sharing your concerns. Please know the service issues you describe are an exception to our guest commitment and as such, we apologize. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

Summary Heading: Great location, and service. My room wasn't terrible at all.
Summary: Took my kids up to LA to visit my father in the hospital, and then we were going to Knotts the following morning. We just needed a place to sleep, and this place was perfect. Karla at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful, the room was very basic and clean. If you just need a place to sleep or rest this place is perfect, especially for the price.

I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the past year and have another scheduled trip in May. Rooms are clean, staff is very accommodating. I'm female and travel alone on a regular basis, I feel safe here. Restuarants are nearby / within walking distance. Close to freeways.  Any problems I did encounter, were addressed quickly and resolved to my satisfaction.

This Motel 6 (#1053) is close to attractions, freeways, and there are quite a few restaurants within walking distance. It has good staff and my rooms have always been clean. Unfortunately the building has become very shabby and run down. The ice machines don't work well, and the last time I stayed there the fire alarms kept going off at night. It is always hard to find a vacant machine in the guest laundry. I visit the area every few months and stayed there several times before I found a nearby motel with nicer, less expensive rooms that included extras such as refrigerators, coffee makers, breakfast, hair dryers, and free Internet.

Worst Motel Ever! I made my reservation online at motel6.com just I have always done. I arrived after the initial check-in time by 2 hours, only to be told that my room wasn’t ready, after I had already given all of my information and paid for the room. I had to wait 20 minutes which wasn’t bad but I was tired from driving and did not receive an apology for my RESERVED room not being ready. I had to remind them that I requested a non-smoking room.  When I finally was able to get into my room, I as completely shocked. I had requested a room with 2 full beds which is what I got but it was so small that the beds were almost touching. The room should have been a 1 bed room due to its size. The rooms were supposed to be updated and modern but the television was an outdated motel. The

It's clean. But the internet is $3 for 24 hours and so not worth it. It's super slow. Then they closed the pool without notifying anyone or putting a notice on the front desk. There's just a piece of paper on the gate saying sorry. The people at the front desk are nice and friendly but I wouldn't stay here again.

The best thing about this hotel is its location. The worst thing about this hotel is its location. Just off the Freeway so ideal for driving arround LA area, but that means when you are outside your room you can hardly hear yourself think. Once door closed the sound is a lot less & didn't disturb our sleep. There are renervations being done but needs some more work. Great value for money but no fridge or coffee making facilities,  which is unusual.  Very friendly and helpful staff.

Summary Heading: There are better places for a similar price.
Summary: We felt the front desk staff was very friendly to us. However, that's about all that met us to my expectations.   Our room was dirty. The tub must have had tub stickies in it at one point, because there was residual ick on the floor of the tub. There is mold on the ceiling of the bathroom as well.   My kids enjoyed the pool. It was small, but it did the job.   The beds are hard and uncomfortable.   I found someone else's hair on my hand towel. We were told that washcloths are a commodity there as guests like to "wash their rims" with them!! Really?  This location is directly adjacent to the 91 freeway. So there is a LOT of freeway noise all the time.   There is also a lot of noise from other "guests" who seem to actually be living at this Motel 6.   I would say find a moderately

Good, not great, needs more work to bring it up to that Studio 6 level. The room was a bit small, but clean. parking is ample and near many resturants. Staff friendly and I would recommend to those off to Knotts.

Made reservations on line. Arrived at noon just to assure I would get my room request (smoking).  WOW. The most unorganized front desk I have ever seen. Room not ready. No problem. Shop a bit, get lunch and got back at 1:30 (room still not ready).  I had items that required refrigeration/heating (had no idea these amenities were not included). Relying on a friend for transport. Went back in and told them I would take a non-smoking room.  I just simply wanted to relax. If we put you in a non-smoking room you will have to remain there!!! For the size, rate, dirty, stinky, only 5 watchable TV Channels (kidding right). Couldn't do anything but go to sleep. The only satisfaction came that evening when Brandy E. and Amanda H. could clearly see how upset I was. THEY helped mend a

This has been by far the most disgusting motel I've ever stayed in. Please, do yourself a favor and stay away from this dump. Room 237 is dirty, carpet hasn't been shampooed in decades, toilet has no lid, just the seat. I was in that hell hole for 6 whole days, and not once was my room cleaned. I had to go to front desk to inquire about my room being cleaned and ask for towels and toilet paper. Rooms are cleaned every 3rd day, but I was there for 6 days and it wasn't cleaned. On the 5th day the person cleaning the rooms asked me if I wanted service and I only asked for towels.  I knew from the get-go that this wasn't a nice, decent place, but I wasn't expecting for it to be so dirty. Upon entering the room, I immediately saw that the carpet had not been vacuumed as I could

All my life I've chosen Motel 6 over any motel or hotel. The obvious choice being the cost comparison to others. I still stand that Motel 6 has the best value for the most part. However...this particular one was the nastiest one ever! Don't be fooled by lower cost and the proximity to Knotts & Disneyland. If it wasn't for the fact that it was late when we checked in, and I paid up front before seeing the room, we would have left immediately. Upon opening the door to the (non-smoking ) room, the stench of musty, smoke, covered by spray deodorizer hit me. The other room was just as bad. I had paid no mind to a customer complaining about her dirty tub when I was checking in until I saw the bathrooms. While the inside of the worn out tub seemed clean, the corners and edges of the

This is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. We turned down the bed to get in and it was covered in hair as if someone had shaved their head all over it. When I called down to the office they asked me to come get the sheets I refused. I should be able to expect a minimum of cleanliness.

Very busy all night long. You can hear people outside the door all hours if the night. Fairly clean for a motel 6. If your taller than 4 ft the shower won't work well for you...The front desk staff were very nice but the price was much higher than the typical motel 6.

The room was terrible. This was the worst Motel 6 I have ever stayed at! I have stayed at many Motel 6 over the years and have never seen one so bad!!  First of all as soon as I walked in The cigar smelled was so penetrated!.. The room smelled like their were 10 cigar smokers in there at the same time. I asked to be move to another room, my daughter has asmtha so this was not good for her!! But the front desk guy told us they were "all booked"..  Even though, 2 rooms infront of our room were not occupied!  He gave us an air freshener! (What is that going to do!?)  the smelled was so strong that we were unable to sleep!! I so regret staying here! It would of been better sleeping in my car!!   The sheets were dirty, the shower tub was plugged! Not a good area and the motel needs

Nice Motel 6 with super pillows instead of the flat ones. AC/heat in room was a bit noisy and the airflow director had been replaced with wire mesh, but worked fine. Carpet a bit spotted. Good areas to walk dogs and met many that were staying at the motel. Always fun. You are surrounded on three sides of the motel with places to eat. Everything from Marie Callendar to Shaky's pizza. Lots of tourist attractions close by on one of the cross streets and very close to both Knotts Berry and Disneyland. My room faced a busy street with lots of traffic. Very nice staff. Not sure what the other places are going for around here, but the location and the price of about $44 per night was doable. I would stay here again all things considered.

Summary Heading: Ok for a trip to disney!!
Summary: We went on june 2013 rooms are clean, friendly staff, the inconvenient that are many people living there and they are very noisy at nights, but for a trip to disney who cares about it , we arrived very tired.  Theres a Jack in the box and a shakeys pizza in front of it,  really  helpful for the breakfast.

Summary Heading: Looking for good service and cleanliness, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!
Summary: I've stayed at other Motel 6's and they have been good, but this was far from it. We arrived around 10:15 PM ready to get some sleep. We got into our room and it had the stale hotel smell. My youngest son used the bathroom and there was hair hanging on the on the bathroom door. When he washed his hands, the sink wouldn't drain.   I called the front desk and the night clerk asked me if we had used anything else in the room, as if she would have moved us to another room if we hadn't. When I told her that my other son had turned the sheets down she said, she was sorry but the hotel was booked solid. Then she said she would not be able to help us and I would need to talk to a manager in the morning. (We ended up washing our hands, faces, and brushing our teeth in the tub while

We come back to the same place every year. The staff if friendly and the rooms are clean. The regular guests are always courteous to the travelers. The front desk always tries to accommodate our special room requests.

Forget getting any ice starting Friday afternoon until Monday afternoon. Slow internet that loses connection more than it should, especially since it's not free. Try to get a room away from the stairs.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa, We apologize for the noise and maintenance issues you experienced at Motel 6. Thank you for your review, and please kindly contact our guest relations department so they can have a record of your experience to help us provide you and our other guests with better service in the future: 1-800-577-3435.

Summary: This Motel 6 is corporate and is very quiet.  The room rates are great, and the service is excellent. There is plenty of parking and it is close to all major freeways in LA.  I left Best Host Inn in Buena Park for Motel 6.  Best Host Inn was great when it was the Crescent Motel.  The new "Best Host Inn" now will not hold a reservation without accessing your credit card first.  They will not let you reserve a room with a discount unless you go through the website.  Motel 6 has no bad attitude, no tricks with your card, and does reservation discounts over the phone!  Bye Bye Best Host Inn!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This was a nice motel. I was just looking for a place to sleep and shower while visiting Disneyland. I wanted something a little away from Disneyland so it would be less expensive. This was perfect. I did not make  a detailed inspection for cleanliness--just a general check for clean beds, linens, towels and bathroom. I would have like to have a refrigerator, but I knew they didn't have them. Beds were very comfortable. When I found out we had a room overlooking the pool, I thought it would be very noisy---NO it wasn't. By about 10pm until 9am, or so, it was very quiet. This is close to many places to eat, gas stations, freeways, about 15 minutes from Disneyland.  Very friendly staff. We loved it. I would definitely stay here again.

Well I'm not sure there were a few things people sitting on steps talking for hours very loud the drug deals going on and the police trying to catch them at it or the stomping across the ceiling while trying to sleep.

Summary Heading: Stay at the one in Stanton instead! Cleaner, Friendlier, and Cheaper!
Summary: This place is a serious joke. The manager Daniel or David, I believe, Has NO idea how to run a business. The service was terrible and the rooms are dirty. There are burn marks in the sheets and on the floor. If you want extra pillows or blankets, You have to walk to the front desk yourself. The manager should honestly be replaced because he is beyond rude and was very childish when confronted about poor service. The one in Stanton is much cleaner and was $15 cheaper for the same day and was way more convieniently located by more restaurant choices. Highly recommend Stanton over Buena Park.

Your front desk staff was wonderful.  The motel itself was frightening.  There was a fight in the parking lot when we arrived.  We, being myself and my 12 year old daughter.  I went to get ice and was approached by a woman asking to use my cell phone to call "Ed to bring flour." Obviously there is not cake baking apparatus, let alone a coffee machine in any room. The smell of marijuana was permeating.  People weren't just smoking it in their rooms, but outside and with their doors open. Even after your loudspeaker announcement which was comparable to being on a cell block stating that people shouldn't be loitering if they weren't residents, people remained outside smoking and wandering about.  I was charged $30 for my stay, even though I left after two hours, didn't turn down a

My husband and I had the misfortune of staying here for a week. The first night there, I called the front desk to let them know I was being bit by fleas. The first response of the staff was to instruct me to call housekeeping in the morning. A few seconds later, the clerk called back and offered to move us to another room the next day because they were booked. We agreed. The next day I showed the bite marks on my arm back and legs and the guy up front acknowledge they were flea bites and offered us another room. When we got to the other room it had a dirty towel on the bed but what took the cake was the ashes all over the toilet and under the lid. We snapped a quick pic and took it back to the front desk where this older gentleman was rude and very unempathetic to our

When I booked this I was a little concerned because it was a Motel 6. But, I didn't have much of a choice since we had just adopted a puppy and this was the only hotel I could find that accepted pets. So I figured we would give it a shot. Glad we did. It's nothing fancy...basically two beds and a tv. But, it was VERY clean and we felt perfectly safe. The price was great and it was very close to Knott's and not too far from Disneyland. I really don't have any complaints. It was comfortable and we all slept very well. We will be back!

Summary Heading: perfectly adequate for a short stay
Summary: The front desk was on a charm offensive when we stayed. First we were offered chocolate and then received a phone call in the room to make sure everything was OK. It was!  For the money, it was excellent. Clean and comfortable, even though the room was on the small side. Excellent value  for money. No complaints. My advice is to check in early for the best room.

I've stayed at this property a few times. Staff is always friendly and courteous and the room is always clean. My greatest complaint with many lower-priced motels is that non-smoking rooms aren't really non-smoking, having heavily shampooed carpeting but the lingering smoke-damage from guests who ignore their policies is hard to ignore. This Motel 6 did not have that problem. It's also fully handicap-equipped, elevator and checkin is invariably quick and efficient. It's not always easy to run an establishment that caters to the budget-minded but they do their job exceptionally well.

This hotel is right of of the interstate so ask for a room not facing the freeway.  We had to move rooms as the first room stunk.  They allow pets here, but they do not clean the rooms properly afterward and the smell is very strong.  Also, as people walk their pets early in the morning we were woken up by barking dogs.  I am a pet lover and have several of my own, but you need to know what your in for.  While we were there a women left the motel because she had fleas in her room. (Luckily, this was not one of our problems.)   The room was OK, but not totally clean.  There was a bug in the light switch in the bathroom and the room smelled musty.  I personally would not stay here again.

Cheap but clean hotel. Within about a 30 min walk to Knotts Berry Farm, or as we discovered on the way back a short bus ride. Surrounded by concrete jungle, freeways and a few convenient restaurants and take away places.

we requested a non-smoking room queen beds. in return we got a double twin beds although the room was non smoking it still had hints of smoke which was disgusting. I had to use my travel sized Febreze spray, went though 2 bottles and it still smelled like smoke. There was a lot of dust on the tables, tv and desk and black stains all over the floors. however the bathrooms were surprisingly very very clean. If this was a completely smoke free motel i would be back but since it isn't i won't be back. Luckily i was only staying here for a night. The hotel staff was friendly and welcoming and bathrooms were clean. the bed comfort level was not great.

I stayed at this property in March of 2011.  I was overdue for some kind of vacation and a friend of mine was temporarily living in Buena Park.  She generously offered to let me stay a few nights with her and she was staying at this location while looking for a permenant place to live.   The room was clean and in good repair.  The pillows were very flat and the comforter was very thin, not what I would normally prefer. There was enough counter space for all my toiletries and hers.   There was a Jack In The Box next to the property, this made breakfast easy.  There was a Target nearby, which was a lifesaver since I forgot to bring something I needed.  I never felt unsafe at any time.  My friend picked me up from LAX and did all the driving, but as far as I remember it was

We stayed 2 nights in a double room. We found it very clean, friendly staff, nothing special really. There was an odd smell in the room that didn't go away- I put it down to the "pet-friendly" policy. OK for the price.

Check in was a breeze the gal at the front desk was very helpful. We needed 2 rooms 1 smoking 1 non smoking at check in there were no smoking rooms ready so the gal at the front desk told us it would be about an hour and radioed the house keeper and asked her to get one smoking rooms ready for us as we were about 2 hours early. As soon as we walked into our non smoking room there was a strong smell of wet dog mixed with animal urine but after being in the room a little bit the smell diminished.The bathroom was clean and bright but also had a dank smell and the shower had low water pressure compared to my parents room. I was surprised that they charged for Wi-Fi as I thought that was a standard feature in hotels now a days. For January the weather was a beautiful 85 degrees but

When I first arrived I thought this was going to be scarey. It was Christmas day and looking for a cheap hotel room to go to Disneyland. I arried at 8 am way before check in times the front desk lady was very nice and let me check in. Room was clean, no bugs, no smoking and no hints of smoke. Bathroom was clean and bathtub was actually big. Bed was really comfy. Its kinda aggervating to get to Disney from it. I kinda reccommend GPS. Overall would for sure stay again. Theres also a jack n the box and pizza place near by.
Great room.  Cleaning staff stole my jewelry. Not that I had it out either. It was packed.   PISSED.

Reserved non smoking but as soon as we opened the door it reeked of cigarette and urine. The carpet was filthy as were the walls. Everything was outdated and grungy. The walkways were filthy and there were cigarette buttts evrywhere. The long term guest were hanging out all over the premises. People sitting on the stairs smoking and didn't bother to move as we were carrying our luggage upstairs to the 2nd floor. It was extremely loud at nigt with people yelling and stomping up and down the hallways. Last time I checked the time before I went to sleep it was 3:30 am and i was up by 6:00 am getting the family ready so we could check out.

Summary Heading: Not really that close to Disneyland
Summary: Yes, you get what you pay for and for $50 a night I suppose it was fine.  No roaches on our visit.  The "nonsmoking room" had the nonsmoking sign on the door, but an ashtray in the room and smelled very perfumey.  But not stale smoky.   We got used to the smell.  Very cramped, but all we needed was a place to sleep.  On another site this came up as very close to Disneyland.  Perhaps as the bird flies.  It took 30 minutes to drive there.  30 minutes to drive, 10 minutes to check in, etc put us in our room almost an hour after we left the park.  We were just too tired for that much extra time.  I wish we'd stayed closer.  On the upside, there is a security guard and a Starbucks on the way to Disneyland in the morning.   And, of course, the towels were very... exfoliating.

Room was pretty cramped and the carpeting looked really dirty.  It looked so dirty, that I made sure my shoes were by the bedside in case I needed to get up in the middle of the night.  The shower head was extremely low and there was no way to adjust it.  We were locked out of our room two times in a stay that lasted from 10/1/09 - 10/3/09.  The night of 10/3/09 I saw a roach on the headboard.  That was it, I checked out.  There was no way I could sleep like that.  Ugh.  When we checked out the night shift manager admitted to knowing of the roach infestation, especially on the 1st floor, which is where I was.  I'm so disgusted that this place is fully aware of this infestation and continues to take money from customers and rent roach infested rooms.  I'd never stay here ever

the room was just ok cramped though the beds were cramped in room not much space to walk around but i did not think it was terribly bad but i do not think i would stay again it was a party hotel too much noise
The rates were affordable and the staff was welcoming. We had a good night's sleep in an area where prices are much higher than what we paid. It was a good buy.

We spent 1 night at the Buena Park, CA Motel 6 and that was more than enough.  The main problem were the cockroaches. I managed to kill all I found and only hope none got in our luggage. The carpet in the traffic areas had not been maintained - cleaned or even swept - there were footprints leading from the door to the bed indicating someone had stepped in something - looked like oil - and tracked it in. The edges of the carpet were thick with accumulated dust and dirt. The bathroom was clean, however, the stool leaked and periodically flushed itself -all night. Our room was very noisy and I would recommend asking for a room away from the elevator, vending and ice machines.

You get what you pay for. It's a typical motel 6 room which is small but efficient. There were a few problems with this hotel. The long term residents were a little noisy, and we saw two roaches in our room. Also, the bathroom shower head was designed for someone very short and there was no way to reposition it.

Summary Heading: convenient, clean, get what you pay for
Summary: you get what you pay for here. stayed to be near knotts berry farm. when we got there it was really hot inside the room. took 24 hours to cool off, no other rooms available on first floor so we stuck it out. we also had problems with room key being disabled; it was on the second evening of a two-evening stay. we'd come back from knotts berry farm hot and tired only to find we were locked out. pool is fairly small and got crowded fast. they do not police the "kids must be accompanied by adults" rule, so lots of parents just watched from their rooms (which means the kids got out of hand fast). but all in all we'd stay there again for the price and convenience.

Summary Heading: You´ll get what you paid and more.
Summary: THE GOOD stuff:  1. Its very near from Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm 2. Right in front of it there are two restaurants 3. About a mile or so on Orangethorpe there is a 7 eleven 4. There is a Wal Mart and Buena Park Downtown neraby 5. The staff at the reception is nice and helpful 6. The cleaning staff do not steal and stay away of your things 7. The towels are changed everyday and if you leave a $2 dollar or so daily, the work will be better done. 8. You are allowed to bring food and beverages. 9. There are plenty of parking space, but don´t expect to get a parking lot next to your room, its a matter of luck. 10. Everithing in the room worked fine 11. Recomend visiting www.motel6.com to reserve and get some really good deals. 12. You can get the LAtimes everyday on a machine

This motel 6 stay was fairly dissapointing. Upon entering our smoking room we discovered burnt out matches all over the floor and one on a bed spread. Upon attempting to pack our car, our electronic key was disabled 40 minutes before check - out time! We had to take a long walk twice to the front desk to remedy this. There was no apology or explanation provided either time. The front desk person who had an assistant manager name tag on seemed merely irritated. She had given the same attitude when checking in. The property was fine, but they need to acquire better front desk staff.

We stayed at the Motel 6 in Buena Park from July 3-8, 2006. We were visiting Disneyland on our way down the coast for the purpose of moving. Since the trip was not originally intended as a vacation, we were excited to find that we could stay at the Motel 6 for less than $50/night, thus allowing us to see Disneyland. The cost is the best thing about this place. Second best was the fact that it is 8 miles from Disney. Though it is a bit farther than we would have liked, we were able to get to the park early, leave midday and come back in the evening.   Our room was relatively clean. We didn't use the blanket or comforter because they didn't look all that fresh, but the sheets were clean. Bathroom had recently been "renovated" and thus was acceptable. Since we were moving, we had

Although the room was clean, the hotel staff was very rude. We booked a non-smoking double bedroom in advance and even though I had my print-out that specifically said it had been reserved, they said I reserved it incorrectly, so I was stuck with four people in tiny room with one bedroom and one double bed. Staff was rude, but room was clean. I guess for 48 bucks you get what you pay for.
